page.title: 11HEALTH.
page.content: {OWSTON RURAL HEALTH SERVICE { ___________________________ Owston residents attend surgeries at Somerby, Billesden and Oakham for medical treatment and advice, and for serious cases the doctors call at the village. Patients go to hospitals in Oakham, Melton and Leicester for surgery, major illness, maternity or accidents. In the case of emergency an ambulance fetches them from the village. The district nurse and health visitor are available when needed. No-one in Owston has chronic illness. Young children are immunised against diptheria, whooping cough, measles, polio and also T.B. in early teens. Comprehensive medical checks are regularly made in schools. Some houses have septic tanks; othersjust have a basic sewerage system. Health and safety officers vist all farms.
